Articles.Content:
With KSP 1.1, something changed with regard to how the transparency is handled for things like Service Bays, in the VAB/editor scene. I'm not sure what has changed or how to work around it.

 

As an example, here's the config from one of the stock service bays:

  

	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleSeeThroughObject
		transformName = TrussMount
		shaderName = KSP/Bumped Specular (Transparent)
		screenRadius = 2.0
		leadModuleIndex = 0
		leadModuleTgtValue = 0
	}

 

I've been using nearly identical configurations in a variety of service bays and interstage decouplers. In some of my configs I specific all of the above, and in others I have omitted shaderName, leadModuleIndex, and leadModuleValue. In all cases, my parts do not honor the "screenRadius" anymore, as of 1.1. The transparency still works for the stock parts, and this section of the CFG hasn't changed in 1.1 for those. While these configs worked for my parts previously, now they're transparent all the time, and I can't figure out what the difference is.

 

Does anyone have any ideas? Have you run into anything like this?

set the shader to KSP/Bumped Specular; your texture's alpha channel (for specular control) is making them extra transparent. I haven't checked stock Service Bay's textures, but I suspect it has no alpha channel, or that is all white. 

Edited April 22, 2016 by nli2work

1 minute ago, nli2work said:

set the shader to KSP/Bumped Specular; your texture's alpha channel (for specular control) is making them extra transparent

 

Huh, OK. I'll give that a shot. Thanks!
Yep, that was exactly what I needed to do. I suppose the underlying defaults changed a bit. I also tried "KSP/Specular" which also worked fine.

yeah, any shader that doesnt' rely on alpha channel to control transparency/opacity should work. Or change the part texture so the alpha channel is mostly white, and use shader's specular color/gloss to adjust specular.
